intro: Lecythis platyzone, commonly known as the broad-leafed lecythium, is a species of tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in diameter. The tree produces heavy, woody fruits that contain a single, large, edible seed. Its bark is thick and corky, providing it with some resistance to pests and diseases. The plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various forms of wildlife.
